Have you seen how much trouble came from trying to make a console version?!?

I didn't.
Well,I don't think ... Maybe you can  make a barbecue on the CPU of the mobile phone when you are playing mobile version of Kerbal Space Program

Dodecahedron-shaped planets. Vertices as mountains.
Simple textures.
And 50 finger gestures to pilot a spaceship.
As we all know, ksp 2 is releasing.. but there's still no ksp for mobiles. You would say ksp's too heavy for mobiles but these days mobiles have upto 12gbs of ram

As we all know KSP 2 is about to release.

What about mobile users who want to play ksp. I have a friend that plays on mobile and really wants to play ksp.

I saw a post 3 years ago, saying that ksp is too powerful for mobiles and SimpleRockets 1 is as far as it can get

WELL

That was 3 years ago and now mobile phones are now powerful such as some mobiles now have 12gbs of ram and that's ALOT for mobile users (I think) 

For example.

You have a craft on your pc that you want to finish but can't cuz your on a holiday or something and your pc is at your home

You only have your phone with you. Well you can download the craft and edit it! (You know what I mean)

You could remove some features but PLEASE add ksp for mobiles, PLEASE.

Problem: https://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings  I haven't seen any phones with all those buttons, gadgets, and thingymajigs.

Also, phones generally only have 4 GB of RAM, and my laptop barely keeps up with 8.

Edited May 1, 2020 by RoninFrog

2 hours ago, OverFlow said:

As we all know, ksp 2 is releasing.. but there's still no ksp for mobiles. You would say ksp's too heavy for mobiles but these days mobiles have upto 12gbs of ram

It's not about ram; it's that the physics calculations that KSP uses would beat up most mobile CPUs. So you'd have to develop a simplified version, and at that point it's just a simplerockets clone.

6 hours ago, OverFlow said:

3 hours ago, Incarnation of Chaos said:

It's not about ram; it's that the physics calculations that KSP uses would beat up most mobile CPUs. So you'd have to develop a simplified version, and at that point it's just a simplerockets clone. 

 Here's the thing. I have a macbook, and macbooks are usually average-ish computers. And then if I start playing KSP, and I have my laptop on my lap, my thighs will be seared. KSP really takes its performance toll. If I try to run it on my windows potato, then well, the whole computer crashes within a minute of opening the game, and it has 32 GB of RAM. And even my potato computer is better than most smartphones. And there's also the graphics. Smartphone "graphics" cards, as you could call it, are nowhere nearly as powerful as a computer's graphic's cards. Also, another question: how would you get mods? How would you build something with an absolutely tiny screen? And how are you going to control everything? Action Groups? Staging? And even if it does get put into consideration, there's really only a small amount of people who want that, and it really complicates things, so they probably won't do it. 

Hope that gives you a wider perspective of things.

Edited May 2, 2020 by Misguided_Kerbal

RAM is beside the point here. The main problem here is that phone processors aren't powerful enough to run KSP. There's only so fast you can run a processor that needs to run off a tiny battery for hours with no active cooling, and that just isn't fast enough for something CPU-intensive like KSP's physics calculations.
Multiple overlapping threads have been merged.

A spinoff game where you could track experiments, have crew rosters, mission patches and flags i think would be a much better idea.
